p: Moderate-to-severe ARDS was diagnosed according to the Berlin definition ( 24): Pa o 2/F io 2 ratio of less than or equal to 200 mm Hg and a positive end-expiratory pressure of greater than or equal to 5 cm H 2O. AKI was defined according to Kidney Disease Improving Global Guidelines (KDIGO) clinical practice guidelines: an increase in serum creatinine values greater than or equal to 0.3 mg/dL (26.5 μmol/L) within 48 hours, serum creatinine values greater than or equal to 1.5 times the baseline within the previous 7 days, or urine volume less than or equal to 0.5 mL/kg/hr for 6 hours ( 25). Preexisting cardiac conditions were defined as congestive heart failure, known conduction system abnormality, or ischemic heart disease. Corticosteroid treatment was defined as at least a dose (≥ 0.5 mg/kg) of methylprednisolone during hospitalization ( 26, 27).
